text: Love this place! The mesquite turkey sandwich is amazing. The little side items they have to buy are unique and change regularly. The staff is friendly and if you have a chance, grab a chocolate cake slice - you won't regret it. Or maybe you will, but at least your mouth will be happy.

I've only been to Nohea Cafe for lunch and it's solid and reliable every time.  Sandwiches and salads are extremely fresh and I find the menu to be creative for a little cafe.  It's out of my budget for daily dining (assuming a drink and chips are also purchased), but is always a very welcome treat.

Wonderful little cafe with an outdoor seating area where they allow dogs. Even brought a cup of water and some treats out for our dog. The soup was kind of bland but the salad and wrap were delicious and fresh.

Nohea Cafe is delicious! I had a hard time finding another coffee place that tasted like Starbucks. I'm obsessed with the Starbucks iced vanilla latte and Nohea Cafes tastes amazing! Their breakfast sandwich and spinach salad was so good, they were very fast and super nice. I highly recommend!

Cute little cafe close to home!  Amazingly delicious sandwiches to try.  I split the The Rickey & The Chicken Pesto Panini. The Rickey was my fav (smoked turkey, bacon, tomato, arugula, smoked gouda & avocado aioli) Everything taste very fresh and yummy. The coffee is delicious too. The place gets a bit busy as it is only open at early hours and the sandwiches are great. My only wish would be for them to be open later.

Three letters... BLT:  have never been combined in such a wonderful way. I get the BLT wrap (and sub a spinach wrap) almost weekly. It's filled with chunks of avacado, crispy bacon and some magical sauce that brings the whole thing together. Add in some Paleo cookies and you've got yourself the meal of everyone's envy. The staff are nice. My only qualm is: you only get one hole punch per visit, even if you order multiple wraps/sandwiches... they gotta reward you for buying lunch for the office right?!?!

Stopped in for coffee and it did not disappoint. They were very busy but the line moved fast and I only had to wait about 5 minutes. I only tried the java but the sandwich station part of this cafe also smelled and looked delicious. The space is very cute and well decorated but also pretty small so many not be the best place to plan to work or come with a big crowd. Would definitely visit again!

Hands down my favorite cafe in Chicago. All of their creations (salads, sandwiches, and breakfast) are unique, made fresh, and so tasty. The ingredients are all very fresh and they have every type of sandwich you can possibly have a taste for. This is our regular spot we go to at least once a week.
Great atmosphere.  Awesome pastry and sandwiches.  Coffee is good too. Customer  services always friendly.

This place is DE-LICIOUS! They also have a sandwich punch card program, so be sure to grab one and you can get a freebie. The staff here are very friendly and are helpful with making the tough decision on what to order (everything tastes so good). All the sandwiches and sides always taste so fresh too. We have order from here for just a sandwich as well as a catering.  They made everything as ordered and the bags they have for to go are super cute. every time I am in this area I just have to stop by and grab a sandwich.

Cafe is only open during the day so although I live across the street I have only been twice. I looked up the sandwich I wanted online, and ordered it but they were out of pretzel bread. I picked focacciaI as my substitute, but it came on a plain dry bun. Bit into the sandwich and there was a huge hair in it (10 inches+ long.) disgusting! Sandwich cost $9.20 but was very small, here is one half. Looks like it would be a cute place for a coffee but would not recommend the overpriced food.

Very nice environment! Food is excellent! Coffee is good! The people are friendly! I had the Ultimate Breakfast sandwich and really enjoyed it. My wife had the Pancho and she liked it. She says next time she'll ask for less cheese. I highly recommend this place!

Went here a couple days ago for lunch and it's a really cute place. Pretty small but it felt cozy. The menu items are written very small above the cashier and you have to look at a different menu to look at all their food options. I tried The Ricky and it was really average. For something that costs $8.25 I expect my panini to taste a lot better! All you could taste was average Gouda and turkey, I had to open the sandwich to check if the cheese in it was actually Gouda because it tasted bland. You couldn't taste any of the aioli or any other flavors that were promoted on the description which makes me think they didn't even add aioli.

Great sandwiches, lots of meat and bread options and high quality ingredients. The line gets long sometimes but it's a very small space so not much they can do about that. Salads are overpriced for their size, but the sandwiches and snacks are way better anyways so don't bother with a salad!

My favorite cafe! Its right around the corner from me and I go there all the time. The Mexican coffee is the best thing I've ever had. Its so delicious! I get it once every so often, because its really sweet, but you can try it with almond milk instead to reduce fat and calories as I do and its just as great. They have great service and a sweet friendly staff. Its a really clean place and has lots of decor to look at. They do have a full menu w/ sammys, salads, etc. Overall I do return frequently and I so much enjoy that the staff is kind.

Wonderful little cafe! We had the BLT and the Chicken Pesto Panini. The bread on both was amazingly fresh. The greens and avocado were nice. Haven't tried any drinks but will definitely be back!  Bummed I hadn't tried it sooner.
I've only had catered breakfast from Nohea, but the muffins are fantastic.

So I'm only giving this place 2 stars because food is good. Went in to grab a quick sandwich and got there at 235 ish maybe and didn't get my food until 250. When I made a comment about how long it was taking the lady making the sandwiches made a rude comment back. This is not the first time someone has been rude here. Boycotted this place for a long time gave it another try now I'm done. I'm a long time neighborhood person and would love for this to be a go to sandwich place when I work from home. I'll walk further down. Sick of the rude treatment at this place I've tried to be nice every time this time I made a comment. No one should have to wait 15 minutes for a deli sandwich. Like I said food is great too bad the staff is not nice or friendly or efficient!

exactly what we were looking for in a fresh, fast, delicious lunchtime spot. The food is delish, the salads are great for vegetarians like me, and the setting is perfect for a "nice" lunch spot where you can actually sit and eat. Loved it.

Found this place while I was staying at a friend's place close by, and totally loved it! The cafe is super quaint and the decor is adorable. They have some great antiques and tables to get work done. The staff were super friendly as well.  For breakfast, I got the breakfast panini (eggs, sausage, and cheese) and the portions were huge. Could definitely split it with someone if you're not super hungry. It was very savory and a great start to my day. The cappuccino was quite delicious as well.  If I lived near here, I would totally come here all the time!

i really like this place.  they have a basic sammie menu & soup-i had potato cheddar with meat soup.  3 kinds of meat.  it was nice if a little salty.  the coffee is Umbria, which is great.  they also have an excellent selection of grocery tasties.

Came here for lunch when I was supposed to be going back to work..oops.. Nohea is a cute little sandwich shop, although the creepy dolls up front threw me off. I ordered the Mike and Mike and grabbed a bag of chips, which they had a decent selection of. I got a cup of water for free, which was in a cute dispenser-mason jar-type thing, and had lemons in it to make it even better! My sandwich was overall pretty good. The bacon was a little crispy for my liking, but the panini was cooked just right and had a lot of meat on it. The sandwich on its own was definitely enough to fill me up. They also had a wide selection of gluten free snacks and gluten free bread as well, which worked out well for my friend with an allergy to it.  Overall this is a cute little cafe that could easily be passed over, but is worth popping your head in for a visit!

Awesome sandwich, coffee, & breakfast spot with an even better atmosphere. I work in the area and get lunch here at least once per week. High quality ingredients and I especially like the bread they use for their sandwiches. I recommend the smokin' turkey but you cannot make a bad choice.  Employees are attentive & friendly. Nohea offers free wifi and overall is a very well-run establishment. The owner is frequently present and it is obvious she cares about all of her customers. Don't hesitate to try Nohea, you will not regret it.

We live right around the corner from Nohea and find ourselves going back again and again. THe sandwiches are fresh, fast and delicious! I love the caprese chicken sandwich made as a panini and the smoking chicken. However, we did have an incident a few weeks ago when my husband had an anaphylactic allergic reaction after eating one of the sandwiches. He is allergic to pine nuts and we clarified that while he wasn't ordering a sandwich with pesto, we did see it was on the menu and made a point to ask If the pesto had pine nuts. They said no and we went on with our business as usual. After about two bites we had to use a (now VERY EXPENSIVE) epipen as his throat was closing up. I don't hold it against them because I didn't specifically request no cross contamination with the pesto, but it is definitely disappointing that after being reassured there were no pine nuts he still had to deal with this (and it cost us a $300 epipen).  Hope they'll be more careful when using products that contain nuts and speaking to their employees about it!

This is a really great sandwich place. I agree with some other reviews that they sometimes skimp on $10 sandwich contents (meats, etc.)  They also have a good assortment of snacks, drinks, novelties, and mini (very mini) grocery section. Sometimes it would take a little longer than expected and/or people that ordered after me would get their food first.  This happens of course, but it would be nice for them to say something to assure me that it's coming soon. Especially when it's the lunch hour and people are ordering to go.   It's one of my go-tos in the West Loop.

Just amazing!!!!! My first time there and the workers are so nice and friendly! The food is beyond amazing at a reasonable price! It's sad I don't live in this area cause if I did id be going there every day! Keep up the great work!
Delicious breakfast (love the tacos), coffee and lunch spot in the West Loop :) A cozy atmosphere to eat, work or talk with friends (indoor / outdoor options). Our neighborhood fave.

The sandwiches here are great and the staff is very friendly. My only complaint is they are really skimpy with the meat on the sandwiches. For example, the corned beef sandwich has maybe 3 pieces of corned beef, a tablespoon of coleslaw and two pickles.  You don't even get a taste of all 3 ingredients in each bite.  For $10 I expect more.

I use to go, FREQUENTLY, to their old location, on Roscoe in Roscoe Village. Love their food and pastries! We used their catering services, numerous times and they were always awesome! I love Shirley and Michelle! They are friendly, sweet and kind...the dynamic mother and daughter duo! Wishing you lots of success at your new location! I'll see you soon!

The owner of the cafe brought lunch to the business I work at as a thank you for our service. Totally unexpected, unbelievably kind, and delicious too! I already loved this cafe for their delicious sandwiches and paninis, but this compelled me to leave them a review. If you're in the west loop you need to try this place!
I've been looking for a good deli for an entire year!! I found one in this place, the sandwiches are amazing!! I will be back!

I've only been going to Nohea since before it even opened (we used to walk past with kids and check out the construction every day)! So great to have a reliable, tasty spot in the neighborhood with good service and good coffee. We love Nohea!
Service was friendly and fast.   Not a huge breakfast sandwich fan,but the ultimate breakfast sandwich made me a convert.  Highly recommend this neighborhood place with top notch food

Came in here for a quick lunch and was pleasantly surprised by the option to make any sandwich on gluten free bread and the knowledge of the employees on which items and sides were gluten free friendly! We both ended up getting the Chicken Pesto Panini on gluten free bread with a bag of chips and very much enjoyed our selection! We both saw many items on the menu that we were interested in and can't wait to try them out! Very rare to find a great spot for sandwiches made with gluten free bread. Hoping to come in for brunch soon to test out their menu

Moved across the street and keep going back to this place all the time. The Italian stallion lunch sandwich is amazing and the breakfast sandwiches are incredible. Super friendly staff and a nice place to sit outside when you want to eat there. Only down side is it is on the pricey side. So be prepared to spend more than your typical breakfast/lunch sandwich spot.  They also have a nice small shopping area by the counter. Includes cooking marinades, salsas, hot sauce and much more. Looking forward to trying out some additional items at this west loop gem!

If I could separate the reviews for food/drink and service, I would give Nohea 3 stars for quality of food and coffee and one star for service.  They have tasty lunch sandwiches and a pretty decent cup of coffee, but their server behind the counter is incredibly rude.  About 9 months ago I went to the cafe in the morning to get a coffee.  I stepped into Nohea, and the barista immediately asked her what I wanted in a very snarky way.  I told her I needed to see the menu to decide, and she rolled her eyes.   I am glad that others had better experiences there, but that was it for me.  I was so offended that I boycotted Nohea.  My coworkers and I will walk 3 blocks out of the way to go to the Starbucks on Madison and Morgan, where the baristas are always sweet and friendly.  I do not like to write overly negative reviews, and I deliberated for a long time while deciding if this review is necessary, but I decided it was the right thing to do.  Nohea should have the feedback so they can improve their service, and you as the consumer should know what you are getting into.  Proceed with caution, and don't expect to be treated well when you go in.

I came to Nohea to grab a tea during CZF.  I was pleasantly surprised by the tea selection.  I didn't stay, but this is a nice little cafe with some limited seating and a decent selection of beverages and snacks.  The big downside was that they close early on Saturdays - I came back during the afternoon to find that they had already closed, which meant no more tea for me.
Tad bit pricey but good food, great atmosphere and nice location for hangouts; lovely ambiance with quotes and pictures on the small cafe's walls.
Desperately needed coffee and a bite to eat on a snowy morning.  This place was quick and tasty.  A really charming place to stop for a coffee.

I love this place. Everything I have tried has been exceptional. No complaints here. Love the wraps. Plus I think I think it's a prerequisite to be adorable to become an employee. The decor is also interesting. I always nothing car something that I never noticed before. I might add, the owner is gorgeous she just need to smile a tad more. Customer for life.

I absolutely love this place! Whenever I am at the Verizon Store on the corner of Throop and Madison, I walk down the way and enjoy a sandwich/coffee. The employees here are so friendly and welcoming each time I visit. Keila has been there for each visit and always has a huge smile on her face! We need more people like Keila in the world!

Nice place. Friendly staff. Really good breakfast sandwich with fresh bread, fluffy eggs, bacon and avocado.  Also free wifi, good coffee, and it is not one of those coffee spots where you feel out of place without a beard and flannel.

I work in the area so I eat here often.  I normally get a salad- the chopped cobb and southwestern are my favorites!  The cobb salad has turkey, ham and swiss- all cut fresh at the deli- with egg, blue cheese, avocado and bacon.  It is pretty good.  The southwestern has pico on it, which is mild to medium in heat (I have a pretty low spice tolerance and enjoy this)!  I tried the bbq chicken salad and wasn't a fan- it was pretty sweet and the chicken seemed low quality. The staff is really friendly.  My only complaint would be that to go orders can take a while (up to 15 minutes) so if you are in a rush, you might want to call ahead.  Overall, I would recommend.
Love the breakfast burrito at this place. Has a very warm neighborhood feel to it. Highly recommend!

This is a really nice spot for breakfast and  deli sandwiches. Cafe has a pretty decent size seating area both inside and out.  I would recommend the All American breakfast sandwich.  They also have some very tasty pastries - def a nice breakfast spot.
The best almond milk latte I have ever had! Nicolette was so sweet and welcoming and her barista skills are out of this world. Will definitely be coming back for more of her latte's.
The most beautiful and delicious BLT I've ever had. How Nohea managed to make this very simple sandwich out of this world yummy I don't know. I can't wait to go back.

First time here.  I got the Greek salad minus the chicken breast (I'm just not a huge chicken breast fan).  The salad is excellent, but I do think the prices are a bit high.  $8.50 plus tip and tax for a salad I can eat in one sitting.  Maybe it's because I didn't get the chicken?  Still, since it was really good, I would come back if I'm in the area and I would recommend it to others as well.

If you've read any of my other reviews you know I'm a sucker for an adorable local coffee shop. Nohea stole my heart and this cafe is more than just coffee and tea.  I met co-workers here for lunch and to work, and I was pleasantly surprised by the size of Nohea's menu! So much to offer. This quaint little cafe has tables that line a windowed wall and a counter full of all sorts of goodies. They offer free water and a waitress brings your food out to your table. I ordered the perfect pear panini which was, well, perfect! The savory and sweet combo was on point. This panini is filled with sliced pear, pancetta, arugula, blue cheese, and muenster. YEAH. Enough said. For $8.25 that's a tasty little lunch. It's a cute spot to post up with your lap top because they offer free wifi. No need to pop in your earbuds, because the mix of music they play is phenomenal! I'm talking everything from oldies, to goodies, to country, to soft rock and beyond. Loved it. Next time I'm in the area I will for sure make another stop in! P.S. Try one of their giant cookies and be prepared to finish it all :)

It's small, quaint, and when you walk in you'll be overtaken by the aroma of delicious sandwiches calling out to you...saying...order up the grown up grilled cheese and add salami! Yep, that just what I did. Though the menu has so many delicious sandwiches and salads to choose from, with the cloudy rainy day, who could pass up a good old fashioned grilled cheese. Don't forget to place your order up front, because if you sit like I did and wonder why there is no service, that's why...ha! When you order they give you a number, and in our case they were even nice to bring our food to the table. I met some colleagues here for a meeting around 1pm. I grabbed the last big table, but take note I might not have been so lucky had I come a little earlier. The good thing is most people seem to come in for take out. And you'll see a lot of people in and out the doors. They move pretty fast here, which is a big plus. You can expect free WiFi, a clean cozy atmosphere, and a staff that seems extremely sweet and accommodating. There is access to free water, which is a big plus for me.  Funny side note...To use the bathroom, you will need a key. Mind you, there is only one bathroom and it's so clean and inviting, with lots of fun signs to read, that you'll feel like staying in there. That's exactly what happened to me. I was waiting for someone to come out, and when she opened the door she apologized and said she got so comfortable in there she started checking her emails on her phone and lost track of time. The location of the cafe is a bit tricky for those driving and in need of street parking. There is a garage across the way, and that's my suggestion for those searching for the perfect street spot.  Great for lunch.
Times must be tough...prices are higher and my salad no longer comes with cheese or avocado, it's all extra now...

I liked the sandwiches and enjoyed sitting outside eating them--but they lost two customers today. Apparently the manager (owner?) Shirley gives strict instructions to her staff that they can sell food but not "service" customers within 30 minutes of closing. We showed up at 2:35 pm on a beautiful Saturday afternoon with our dog. The outside tables and chairs were locked up, so I asked inside if they could unlock them. The friendly counter girl said they lock them up as they're getting ready to close, but that shouldn't be a problem. I placed our order and went outside. Inside I saw the supervisor come out (Nicolette) and tell the counter girl she's not allowed to unlock them. She said we were welcome to eat inside (Not sure what we would have done with our dog). I had the girl cancel my order and refund the money. And then talked with Nicolette and expressed my disappointment that she would not take the thirty seconds to unlock sidewalk furniture. She said her boss Shirley--who was not there--has made it very clear that the outside furniture should be locked up 30 mins prior with absolutely no exceptions.  Surely Shirley can't be serious?  I guess she does not want her people to exert even thirty seconds of effort for her customers to enjoy eating the food she sells. Lost s customer.
Great food and coffee. Had the breakfast burrito and it was perfect. Can't wait to munch through the rest of the menu.
Small cute cafe. Needed a place to sit and relax. Only had some drinks here but they were good and the environment is very conducive for friendly conversation and working. Staff is very nice.

I was hooked after one bite of their delicious breakfast Sandwich-  Eggs, cheddar cheese and bacon on a croissant sandwich. YUM. Not to mention they use Boar's head meat which makes it that much better. I've also had their breakfast tacos, breakfast burrito and Turkey Sandwich on a pretzel bun.   It's a little pricey, but that's what happens when you go to a small town restaurant. The staff is always really friendly too!

Came in here with my sister and ordered some paninis. She got the Ricky and I ordered the Italian hero. Both very good. The Space is cozy, quiet and perfect if you need to catch up on some work, or reading.

I found this place on a whim, I just arrived in chicago,walking down madison looking for a restroom. I wasnt even hungry, but The atmosphere  was very inviting I ordered a tommy cubana with turkey instead of pork, and let me just say that that sandwich was the best sandwich I ever tasted. The prices are affordable, the service is good and the food delicious. What more could you ask for. Even though the festival I came for wasnt what I expected, the drive from Milwaukee to Chicago was worth it after i had that sandwich

Honestly I love the food, I go here almost every day for lunch because it's on my block. But today I had it delivered because I wasn't allowed to leave my desk. I received my food and it had a $5 delivery charge - which is over half the price of my meal that was delivered one block away. Absolutely ridiculous. Also there is no note of the delivery charge on the website. absolute rip off.

I like this place it is really close to my job so I can go there for lunch and breakfast! They have really tasty sandwiches and pastries, but I got a smoothie from there and it just didn't taste good to me Other than that it's a great little cafe!

I love this little gem in the West Loop. It's a perfect spot to grab a coffee or a salad! Everything is freshly made to order, and super delicious! They also have some really cute and festive cookies, and chocolates that are a perfect little gift for a friend- birthday, holiday, just because!  My favorite thing on the menu, that I consistently order is the Southwest salad (although I sub grilled chicken instead of the standard smoked turkey.) It's my favorite salad in the city right now.  Also a great spot to go to if you need to pull out your laptop/ipad and get some work done. It's a nice alternative to sitting at a Starbucks, and has a great neighborhood atmosphere. I'm a return customer!

Adorable, uplifting, hands down delicious food. What more can I say...Nohea Cafe has it all! I stopped in for lunch today and was instantly impressed the second I walked through the door. The cafe itself is decorated so cute. It warming and homey, and all of the uplifting quips and quotes that adorn the walls are so unique and different from any other corner cafe I've seen.  The menu is quite large for a lunch spot which was pleasantly surprising, but also posed a hard decision as to what I will be ordering. It consists of sandwiches, wraps, salads, and paninis. After a long, hard thought, I went with the tuna salad...salad. It was SO FRESH! The tuna was light enough but had such great flavor and the salad underneath was comprised of only the freshest ingredients. I gobbled it all up in record time!  Also offered at Nohea Cafe is a unique coffee and latte menu. I wanted to try so many thing such as a carmel macchietto, the Mexican blend, or the aloha latte which has coconut. Trying to eat healthy today, I decided to go with the Americano, which again, was nothing short of pure bliss.  Noteworthy: Nohea's special snacks they sell at the counter. These special snacks include assorted teas, popcorn, toffee, cookies, brownies, and additional candy and sweets for days. I felt like I was an ole school corner store, right on Madison Ave! I can't get over how perfect Nohea Cafe is. I'm already thinking about what I am going to order there for lunch tomorrow...because oh yes, I will be returning tomorrow. Whatever you do this week, give Nohea a try...you will not regret it;)

Great sandwiches and lattes. The can make almost any sandwich gluten free, and the gluten free bread is actually good too! I  am addicted to Nohea. I wish I could visit more, but any time I am in the neighborhood I try to find an excuse to go. I recommend the Tommy Cubana Panini ( I get as a sandwich to avoid cross contamination on the panini press) and Chicken Caprese sandwich.

I love this place. I always get a friendly hello every time I walk in. The cashier Judy is so sweet and if there weren't people in line behind me we could talk all day. My food always comes out fast and is delicious every time. But geez I feel bad for the cashier because I've seen the snooty people that come into that place and they are not easy to deal with. I guess it's just the neighborhood. Yuppies. I looked at some of the bad reviews and they're probably those yuppie customers that give that nice girl such a hard time, or they just have a stick up their butt :). But to each their own I guess. Whatever. Nohea cafe gets five stars from me. It's my go-to cafe. Thanks for that Judy and Shirley!

The paninis are good, but they take awhile to receive.  I just had a take out order, and found the associate at the cash register to be short and impatient while I was looking over the menu.  (I find it weird that there's no overhead menu for the sandwiches, and that I have to look at a small menu.)  I don't get a warm, friendly feeling here.  I'll go to the American Bagel place that has paninis just as good, better service and for less.

Nohea to me, can be best described in one word; "fresh". Everything tastes fresh, the sandwiches are flavorful and creative, service is friendly and they offer gluten free bread which is not necessary, but very thoughtful, in my book. I have a friend with an allergy, and "How about Nohea?", when we are deciding where to eat always brings a smile to her face. Just a great neighborhood place with fresh, delicious food.

Yum! I go here often before going to the gym across the street. Their Greek Bowl is my favorite, and keeps you full for a long time. The ingredients are fresh and tasty. The atmosphere is also casual and relaxing. The only downside is they went a bit overboard with inspirational quotes on the wall, but who cares!
Awesome sandwich/bakery/coffee spot. We go here after a serious workout at the gym across the street. Def recommend the chicken pesto panini!
Love this place...stumbled on it by chance and everyone was very nice. Great selection food wise. Would definitely recommend it.

This is how good Nohea is: We are a production company, and have a lot of freelancers come through our office in the west loop. They are always asking for recommendations on where to eat - easy request, considering we are located at the epicenter of delicious food. So Nohea has a lot of competition, yet they are the ONLY restaurants that freelancers and clients have ordered from multiple days. I had one producer tell me the other day that they were plotting their next order from them already, they loved Nohea so much. They couldn't stop talking about it. And keep in mind these are people who have, in the same span of time, eaten at Little Goat, Butterfly, Wishbone, De Cero, Salsa Truck, and Protein Bar.  Get anything and everything. I have not once been disappointed with anything I have gotten there, it's all been A+++ food. Last time I went in for an order, the woman behind me overheard my order and enthusiastically jumped in, recommending swapping out the bread to make it even better. Clearly their clientele loves the place too. And the staff is accommodating, super nice and friendly.  Also they have free saltwater taffy on the tables. FREE. How can you go wrong with that?!

We stumbled upon this cute cafe when visiting a nearby playground, and we'll definitely be back! The space is a bit cramped but felt more cozy than uncomfortable. There are decorations everywhere, lots of goodies and nostalgic candy for sale. The little bowls of free saltwater taffy at every table or flat surface basically, were a cute touch. Also, the basket of children's toys were a cute touch too, kids get restless fast!! I read that other people did not like the religious overtone of this place; I noticed subtle things like the wifi password being a bible passage, and little quotes around the shop, but the noise of the day to day customers drowned out the "Jesus music", which I didn't even hear. The religious aspect didn't seem like a big deal to me, at all. The food and coffee was very yummy and I felt, fairly priced. The staff were nice and accommodating. All in all, a quality spot that we'll visit often, I'm sure! (One star is missing because the food and drinks do take quite some time to be made, but in a small place with limited staff, where everything is made to order, it happens! Not a deterring factor at all, but something to mention)

This place is definitely one of those overrated, over-priced cafés every city is filled with. The food is pretty mediocre, none of the sandwiches are special in any way. Just 10 dollar sandwiches with boars head meat (which is pretty good), but with bread that tastes like it was baked the day before and then way too many, not meshing well toppings to try and distract your palate and convince your taste buds that you're eating good food. The coffee is really bad. The workers there seem to have potential but all seem to cower in fear of the manager and owner, who are openly rude to them, which I saw both of the two times I have been here. Disappointing because I was excited about this place, I just moved half a block away. Simplify your menu, Nohea. Lower your ridiculous prices for a deli meat sandwich and treat your employees better, especially in front of customers. Your employees WILL make or break your establishment and there is nothing you can do about that. So they should probably be happy.

I stopped in here for a quick breakfast and had the Buenos Dias Scramble and an Almond Latte.  The scramble is really more of a breakfast taco, as it's wrapped in either a flour or corn tortilla.  I did not specify so they served mine on a flour tortilla.  It was delicious and more food than I needed for a light breakfast.  If you aren't starving and don't need a lot to eat it may be enough to split with someone. The almond latte was also delicious, made with almond tea.  I would recommend checking this place out if you are in the area looking for breakfast or lunch.

This is my perfect cafe. Tasty lunch menu, affordable food, laid back environment, FREE SALT WATER TAFFY, wifi, and plenty of tables and electrical outlets. It's my office away from my office. Well worth a visit if you live or work on the west side.
This little gem has free wifi and great Boar's Head Sandwiches. The Pretzel bun was great and the service pretty fast and super friendly! I will be back to this west loop deli!

Freaking delicious food (get the Spanish Verde sandwich) & blended/iced drinks (included an interesting almond green tea). It's down the block from my yoga studio, so I'm always coming in & appreciating the spiritual decor & happy staff. Highly recommended! The only request I would make is to offer some vegan options!

I wish this place were better because I just moved in the neighborhood.  Only a couple of non-meat options for sandwiches.  I ordered an expresso drink with soy that was luke warm and the scone was not fully baked.  Not really their fault since they don't bake on premises.  if you go in the mid-morning, the staff could be busy preparing catering orders so it isn't very peaceful.  The decor is cute and homey and the staff is friendly.
Had a great veggie sandwich, the lady next to me even complemented. Free coffee with a check in and the barista give it to me iced. Sweet spot, so close to where I was saying. Awesome all around

I no longer like this place. In the year that I've been going, I've seen their prices rise while the food portions get smaller and smaller. The straw that broke the camel's back was today when I paid ten bucks for a salad that looked like it was made in Smurf Village. My purse is $10 lighter and I'm still hungry. I'm done with this place!

I got the chicken salad sandwich again. Can I buy a tub of that? I respect a business that takes their customer's suggestions into consideration - today there was a stand near the door with menus! Thank you!

Staff does not wear name tags so I have to describe another way - with that said I was there this morning Asian girl asked me what I wanted ...  She asked me for my name I told her my first name , by that point another staff was in the vicinity , Asian girl was trying to type my name when this other staff girl said "just put Rose" with a scoff.  This other girl staff apparently was rushing to ring up her customer for 30-some odd dollars.  So that was that - I thought .   This other girl staff motions the Asian girl to keep ringing and she "fixes " my latte.  That was it!   After a couple of sips I noticed it's bitterness   That latte was not worth one dollar.   I think her bitterness seeped into the latte. She may be bitter because she can't spell?  Bad energy translates to bad customer service !

Have you ever wanted that place where people respect customers and never disappoints? This place kills it! I just ordered a breakfast burrito unlike any other I've ordered or made myself. The barista makes a gold medal mocha too. It's a corner deli/coffee shop/breakfast/lunch combo id come to daily if I lived closer, just work near by. The price doesn't break my bank either. Bring everyone you know! I'll try.

blah. overpriced food, horrible service. seem to be understaffed and the few workers they do have are either distracted or just plain dumb. how hard is it to give me my drink with my order? should I have to ask 3 times? add in the dirty tables, food on paper plates and this is a definite skip, especially at these prices. but hey they do sell jewelry for some reason!

I've lost track of how many times I have came here for lunch and not once have I been disappointed.   The staff is super friendly and they have added out door seating for when it gets to busy inside. Great place for a small group of people.

Answer your phone or actually call people back when your message says you will.  They never pick up the phone.  Lost a potential weekly customer with large orders.  I hate flaky businesses like this.  If they are too good for my business I will gladly go elsewhere in this HUGE city of Chicago

I randomly found Nohea Cafe while perusing Yelp for a lunch place and was initially intrigued by their name (meaning "lovely" in Hawaiian). I'm from Hawaii, so there was no question that I wouldn't try it out. It quickly became a regular weekend spot when they were in Roscoe Village, and it's still worth the trip now that they're located in West Loop. I love every sandwich I've tried-- Smokin' Turkey, Chicken Caprese, Sassy Roast Beef, The Spicy Ralph, Spanish Verde. Definitely my fave sandwich spot in the city!

I'm so impressed, it's kind of a hidden jewel in the area.  Where do I start, they're a cafe but highly meticulous in what they they stock--boar's head meat, candy=gourmet and some unusual, baked goods huge and fresh, loose leaf teas, and cool and diverse 'health food bars'.  The sandwiches are maybe a dollar more than you'd find elsewhere, but after getting one I see why, they're huge and everything is seriously fresh.  The wait really isn't that bad, especially when there is so much to look at and shop around on and yes, they even sell adorable jewelry at the back of the store (presumably hand made by locals).

Once again: Nohea is Winning. Today I tried the Buffalo chicken wrap, It was DELISH! I had no intentions on eating the entire wrap but I could not stop! hands down it was the best wrap I've ever had. It never "unraveled" it was filling and mmmm mmmm good to the last bite. I am glad I live in the city and can have this at my leisure!
This is a cute little cafe with great food.  The downside is that it's pretty expensive and they are never open.

Went here yesterday for the first time.  I had The Stan and my friend tried the  Spanish Verde (veg).  Both of us really liked the sandwich...fresh avocado and cheese yum.  The tomato basil soup was delicious.   The cafe has a really nice relaxing setting too.  Will surely be back!!

I really enjoy this place. The location and menu are my style plus the location is great for those in the west loop looking for a good lunch rob fast option.  They do need to work on the speed of the service (good food takes time is posted but as others noted this is a very long amount of time most days). I only go when I have some time- this is not a quick stop for takeout.  The food is really good and I've never had anything I don't like. I love the hot tea/coffee as well.  Service most of the time is great but I have been in the place a couple of times on a "bad" day where the friendliness lacks a bit.  Overall I'd recommend for quality food at good prices.

2 stars for coffee and for 5 stars service ,food and interior design. Girls over the counter were extremely nice.  The breakfast tacos big,  tasty and hot.  Bathroom clean,  smelled fresh.  Coffee unacceptable. Sorry guys.  I really wanted to give you 5 stars but you coffee is below average.  I will come back for sore but I'll skip the coffee.
Great sandwich place. Was running errands nearby and randomly found this place through the Yelp app. Stopped in for a quick lunch and the sandwiches were fantastic.

Great Product (Boars Head) "Lovely" Idea Horribly executed Rude owners Paninis take too long Overwhelming menu that's not posted. You wait in a candy clustered doorway with no menu up waiting to order, then your hit with all these sandwiches. Come on now ladies this is a cafe, leave a full menu to Viaggos next door. Pick 8 of your top sellers, make those awesome CONSISTENTLY, and stop trying to make this an episode of Iron Chef (you'll probably hear them yelling at an employee). Maybe then customers can focus on good eating. 1/2 sandwich combo.... More like 1/4, definitely not half. Makes going to the local cafe a drag. Not enough seating, lets say this again NOT ENOUGH seating.  Workers fall off here like leaves in the fall. If this place got its shit together they still couldnt land an episode of Chicagos Best. Stick to catering ladies.

The  good- food is yummy, especially the breakfast burrito. Cafe au lait is delicious reminds me of Paris! The bad- holy cow how long does it take to make a panini??? I waited over 15 minutes for my Togo order. There were 3 other people there. Unless they were out catching the turkey I don't really understand. I know "good food takes time" but still!
Delish - both coffee and sandwich. Best part, that have a VERY clean bathroom!!! I rarely even use public restrooms so I hope that puts that VERY into perspective.

This is definitely our favorite sandwich place in all of Chicago.  I know that's quite a bold statement, but Nohea Cafe certainly deserves it.  Their service, food, coffee, and baked goods are all top-notch.  They also have fantastic catering service.  I will recommend Nohea to anyone. PS - some nut job 1-star reviewed this place w/o even trying their food (based on driving by during non-business hours)?  Really?  Really?!
Get the breakfast sandwich and add ham or bacon. So good!!!!

The is the most adorable coffee shop!!! They have great coffee, great service, and an extremely cute environment to start your morning!  There are multiple baked goods options, and even though they don't have decaf coffee, they make a wonderfully aromatic decaf americano! They also make killer cuppacinos!  There are also delicious sandwiches with Boars Head deli meats, as well as a gluten free bread option that is actually very high quality and tastes a bit like real sourdough bread! The cashier/server was extremely cheerful and helpful :) and a delight! They serve breakfast till 11am, and there are sandwich and salad options for lunch :) i would love to come here all the time just to read a book in the mornings and relax. go check it out!!!

This is my new spot for lunch in my neighborhood.  The sandwiches are delicious and they use Boar's Head meat which I am always a fan of.  They put a good amount of meat but not too much.  It's perfect.  So far I have just ordered the half sandwich (Chicken Caprese) and salad (mixed green).  Both have really fresh ingredients and you don't feel tired and run down when you finish.  I usually get a cup of coffee (Julius Meinle) which is also quality.  I know I haven't tried much of the menu but this combo is so good it is hard to stray.  It isn't just the food that brings me back but it is also the service.  The staff is super friendly and always smiling.  The cafe is always spotless and so well taken care of.  Very impressive.

Excellent value for $ with superb quality.  The one and only cafe in the barren Madison/Racine area. Coffee -- Julius Meinl.  Aloha Latte is unique and embraces the cafe's touch of Hawaiian theme. Food -- excellent quality, organic at a competitive price.  The kiddie PB&J is fit for the child in all of us (aka Big Kid) on a whose wheat bread with nuts.  Sliced banana.  All natural, preservative free, real cheese Fish Cracker.  Yay!  Extensive menu. Venue -- comfortable home style cafe that is packed (yet spacious), nicely decorated with global travels and neatly organized.  One main table is impressively made of sustainable wood. Staff/Service -- everyone is sincerely nice.  Wi-Fi -- password printed on small paper tucked away near the water jug. Parking -- easy. When in the area, I shall gladly visit!
Big fan of this place.  Delicious sandwiches.  Though it takes a little bit of time, it's well worth it.  I love getting the chicken caprice on whole wheat!

My work has placed large lunch orders from here twice and both times, great food and wonderful service.  Sandwiches & salads are top notch & their homemade chips are a must.  We'll be ordering from Nohea's again, for sure!

Yay!  This place is awesome and I will definitely be back.  My girlfriend and I were looking for a place that had good sandwiches, salads, soups, pastries, coffee, etc. This place has all of the above!  I actually read the yelp reviews and decided to give it a try.  The place is cute (not too big) but definitely can accommodate a decent sized crowd. The outdoor seating is a plus! The menu is impressive (lots to choose from).  I had half sandwich and soup (Smokin Turkey and the tomato basil soup).  The 1/2 sandwich was a little smaller than I anticipated but it was very tasty. The soup was delicious too!  I definitely recommend going back.  The food is a little pricey for what you get, but I think they have a nice selection of food.

If you're looking to get a quick breakfast on the weekends this place is great.  My wife and I like to get sandwiches here on the weekend.  I also like that this place has baked dog treats as well.  My dog especially loves them!  My only issue is that I wish this place was open later during the week and open on Sundays.

With the addition of outdoor seating. This is by far one of my favorite places in the neighborhood. The menu is creative and tasty. There are plenty of great options, and they have gluten free bread! Which makes it possible to get sandwichs with my wife for once. Julius Meinl coffee rounds this place off. I come here for breakfast occasionally, and again can't go wrong.  People may find it pricey, but only if you don't realize the quality of the ingredients that your getting. I feel like I'm getting great food at value. So...five stars it is.

What a great little corner spot this place turned out to be. They're relative newcomers to the neighborhood, but they've already left a rather fond impression. I work in the west loop and I notice a ton of my coworkers downing Nohea's coffee and grabbing their sandwiches. For me? I'm more a fan of their chips and smoothies, but there really is something here for all audiences. The wait staff is as friendly as it gets, too. If you want good deli food with great service at a reasonable price per portion size, check out Nohea. Unlike other places nearby, they welcome customers to sit and dine and take their time, which is always appreciated for when you don't feel like rushing. Overall a cute, cozy cafe with fine eats. Oh, and also, may I recommend some of their carmel popcorn? It's pretty darn good.

This place is WAY overpriced. I ordered a tuna tostada (not sure why tostadas are on the menu at a sandwich shop in the first place...) and paid $9. I took me 2 bites to finish it and wasn't anything special. It's also a bit confusing when you walk in. I stood there for awhile before someone asked if I wanted to see a menu. I must say that I'm mostly disappointed because I think good cafe's are hard to come by in the West Loop and really wanted this one to be good.
A welcome additio to the nieghbrhood.  Great fresh sandwiches and home made chips!  Perfect spot ofr coffee or lunch!

first let me get it out there - I think Nohea Cafe is a bit pricey.  there I said it.  I think a sandwich - especially one that is between $8-$9 should at least come with a side of chips - those heavenly Nohea Cafe chips. ok, now that I have that out of the way - this place is so cute and cozy.  yes, it's a little cramped, but in this case, they make it work - it's charming.  maybe if it was so cramped with people the day I was there I wouldn't feel that way - but when I was there, it worked.  I can't wait to return. My sandwich was a chicken caprese and I also bought some chips - those heavenly sea salt housemade chips - and a fresh brewed iced tea.  I loved that sandwich, but the bread on there was so good I could have eaten it alone with the chips and I would have been happy. They also have old school retro candy, in addition to several kinds of pastries (including black and white cookies)...my next trip will be for dessert, coffee and conversation for sure.   Quick note - you order, pay, get a number and sit....but get your drink first.  We were kind of confused when we first walked in and got it all wrong :-/  but the nice counter lady and server helped us cause we were totally clueless... Nohea Cafe..until we meet again :)

Its been more than 4 months that im going to this place every day not only because there is a good looking girl working there :)  ITS for the amazing sandwich that they  are makeing  you should try the amazing pretzel roll with roast beef and sweet potato chips on the side
I like this place... it's unique and tasty.  A nice new addition to the neighborhood.
Sandwiches here are delicious, I got to try the Spanish verde and the dessert panini. The staff is friendly n the artwork on display is cool. Great cafe in the neighborhood.

Delicious sandwiches. For those of you who have complained about the price - you pay for what you get. Boar's Head meat - enough said.  If you want the best in food quality, you have to pay a bit more. ; )

As others have mentioned, Nohea is a great addition to the West Loop! The food is good and the atmosphere is very quaint. I'm a big fan of the Morning Glory breakfast sandwich, croissants and scones, while my husband prefers the ham and egg breakfast croissant. Coffee and lunch sandwiches are delicious as well. My only small complaint is their odd hours. For a café serving breakfast and espresso, it's bizarre that they wouldn't open before 8am on weekdays (and would love for them to be open Sundays as well). I understand it's a family run business, but would expect that they could hire someone to open earlier.  Since I've been raving about Nohea to coworkers, one tried to stop by the other morning. When she went to open the (locked) door, she was met with a blank stare by the woman behind the counter as she had arrived at 7:55, trying to make it to work by 8. Instead of opening a few minutes early, the woman stood there until my coworker walked away. Seems like a missed opportunity to impress and welcome a new customer.

A nice addition to the West Loop neighborhood. The sandwiches can be a little bit pricey, but they are made to order. Great coffee too. I've only ever been here for lunch and it's always a bit of a wait to order and then wait for your food. The sandwiches are good -- the Sweet Cubano is my current favorite.

I would love to write a review about this place.  I drive by it every day on my way to Kid's school and when I work out.  This places's hours are similar to bankers hours.  Closed on Sunday and at 3 pm on Saturday.   The menu looks awesome and someone brought me coffee .  I cannot seem to sync to their interesting operating hours!

It was one of the saddest days of my life when Nohea left my neighborhood of Roscoe Village and moved to the West Loop.  I LOVE Nohea, its ownership, staff and especially food.  I'm so jealous of you West Loopers for getting one of the most charming sandwich/pastry/coffee/ice cream cafes in the city!  I love it so much that I'm willing to make the trek from Roscoe Village to the West Loop in Saturday afternoon traffic just to get there. Totally kid friendly (toys and stuff for kids to play), kid-friendly food line the shelves, and the staff lets you stay and linger over delicious sandwiches and probably the best ice cream ever (Ashby's).  It's a mom-daughter team that owns and runs the cafe, and they do it really well.  Try their breakfast croissant sandwich - piled high with eggs, the crispiest bacon, cheese on a flaky large croissant.  You can also custom order sandwiches, paninis and wraps.  The coffee is really delicious. There's room for strollers, and the owners love kids (nice large bathroom with very nice kid changing table).  That said, for you non-parents, it's not over run with kids, so no worries there either. The traffic flow is good, decor very elegant but still comfy and cozy and food is very fresh and made and brought out on a timely basis.  Despite my best efforts, I still haven't found a substitute for Nohea in or around Roscoe Village.  Maybe I'll have to move to West Loop to get my daily Nohea breakfast croissant/coffee fix.

Really has alot of potential but for the price you get a TINY sandwich and nothing else with it.  Same prices as Jerrys but way smaller portions and no side or pickle.  My sandwich today had more lettuce and bread than meat and cheese and it was very dry.  For a size comparison the sandwich had a diameter about 3/4 of the length of an iphone. Lots of potential and very nice staff, just not enough quality or bang for your buck quite yet.

Great sandwiches! This is a very cute cafe in the West loop area. My friends and I came  here (total of 7) for lunch. We each ordered a sandwich (except for one who ordered a breakfast croissant). Sandwiches were decent. Nothing to complain. The drinks were okay.  The owner of the cafe was really nice and offered us free desserts (probably because we were there to test out the food and environment for throwing a potential bridal shower there). She gave us more than enough desserts to try out. The desserts tasted okay..the chocolate cake was probably my favorite. The others were eh.. ok.  Overall decent experience. Cute cafe, again!

Very intimate and cute cafe! I went with a group of 7friends to try out this cafe and we ordered sandwiches, paninis, and salads. Although this place will be a little crowded/tight for big groups...Everything looked and tasted great! I loved my aloha latte. The owner noticed us chatting for a while after having lunch and she offered us a free plate of yummy pastries! Will definitely go back if I want a comfortable place to sit down and have a drink with delicious pastries or quick bite!

My daughter and I stopped in for a sandwich. Wow, were we pleasantly surprised. In addition to the warm atmosphere, the soup and sandwiches were delicious and pretty stacked! Hot Chocolate was excellent. Owner introduced herself and was very nice and appreciative of our business. We brought the baby stroller in and it was no problem. We went back two days later because the original experience was so good!  A great addition to the neighborhood.  Cant wait to try their breakfast sandwiches!

Horrible experience.  They claim to be kid friendly but clearly are not !!!  My child ( who has some disabilities) and her friends were playing with the toys (that they provide) and being silly & enjoying themselves.  The owner came over and sarcastically told us we needed to sit down in their seats.  She was clearly annoyed that the kids were not sitting down eating.  DON'T HAVE TOYS AND CANDY IF YOU DON'T WANT KIDS TO PLAY!  When I confronted her she told me that I should have control over my kids.   Horrible place.    Don't go here if you have kids & especially don't go here if your child has any disability.   UNPROFESSIONAL & RUDE!

I live down the street from Nohea Cafe.   Everyone around has been waiting for a cafe to open around us.  Nohea has some really great sandwiches for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  The coffee is really great and the owners seem very friendly, but very much seem like they are really busy training and handling the staff. I would say the atmosphere is definitely not relaxed and quiet... a lot louder, more like a deli.  There is a comfy couch to hang out on.  I believe they do catering, so there could be a lot of "hustle" around that side of their business.  They frequently have catering packages laid out on customer tables, taking up valuable space that customers could be sitting down in... not a very good idea.  Isn't there space in the back you can store your catering? Definitely love having them down the street from my house, as Morgan Street Cafe is a lot further walk.  Although I Morgan Street has a more relaxed cafe atmosphere, Nohea has better food.

I stopped into Nohea for the first time this morning. The place is cute, the bagel I ordered delicious, but the owner (I assumed) was a little bit off. She was aggressive and whiny with the staff (who were waiting on me at the time), and stood behind the counter--in full view and ear shot of all customers--having a conversation on the telephone about hiring a new employee. To top it off, she wasn't even nice to whomever was on the other end of the line. Don't you have a back room in which you could conduct your business? I didn't get a good vibe from the place and I was made uncomfortable by the aggression coming off this lady. I don't know... I don't think I'll be back, as I prefer the really warm, friendly environment of Morgan Street a few blocks east. Truly though, good bagel! Maybe it was just a bad day for this woman? Who knows.

So happy this placed opened in my neighborhood. The Julius Meinl coffee is great and the baked goods are delicious. I had a Southwest salad for lunch - its HUGE and very tasty. The service is very friendly and the space is so cute and warm. They also have a fun selection of candy, specialty gourmet items and jewelry. I'll definitely be going back a lot!

Really cute spot, friendly staff, and tasty food. They have a great little selection of specialty snacks, drinks, and groceries. Boars head meat is a huge plus, too. I would complain that their prices are pretty high, but it seems like they use high quality ingredients, so i can let it slide. I ordered a breakfast croissant and it was STACKED with eggs and bacon, def worth the price tag. seriously, there was enough scrambled egg to feed a family :) Food comes out fast, and they have tables to sit at and relax for a minute. I work down the block, otherwise this west loop neighborhood wouldn't really appeal to me as a place to walk around and find a bite to eat. i recommend stopping in and trying a sandwich or coffee here
Excellent place; wonderful food, coffee, service, atmosphere ... such a necessary addition to the neighborhood.

WHAT A GREAT ADDITION TO THE WEST LOOP!   Thanks for joining our neighborhood! LOVE the menu here, with great breakfast and lunch items, including all Boar's Head meats - what a huge difference! Creative and interesting items  noheacafe.com   I had the most incredible tea today:    Roasted Almond Iced Tea This was an incredible find! Each item is carefully, hand made, so it will take a couple of minutes, but don't worry, you can nosh on the outrageous baked good or premium ice creams! WOW, need to start walking more, to make room for their delectables!

Firstly, how the heck do you pronounce the name o fthis place. Second, this is a good little café in Roscoe Village. The bacon, egg, and croissant sandwhich is like an upscale version of Dunkin' Big & Toasty. Clogs my arteries but brings a smile to my face. * from my visit on 12/30/11

Oh Nohea you have been so disappointing lately. Here's the thing- i LOVE their food.  The mixed greens and Spanish Verde are just so delicious. And the decor is so cute.   But this place is in need of a serious management overhaul.  Every time I have gone in there in the last couple months, it's chaos.  There are always 4 or 5 people behind the counter, but it takes the food forever to come out and it takes people FOREVER to order.  Yesterday, I called in an order for take out.  I was in there for upwards of 20 minutes just waiting to pick up from the counter. Two women cut me in line.  I understand that this could be a one-time thing, but this is ALL the time.  The staff need to manage their time and customers better. I am so frustrated but will continue to go because truly their food is so good.

great atmosphere for a quiet breakfast or lunch. Christian coffee shop = peaceful and joyful! kid-friendly. caveat: closes early, around 3. I am from Denver and my computer time is Denver time so I had NO idea that 1: they were closing and 2: the correct time. They didn't rush me; the opposite, they were totally cool with me finishing up my work and then leaving. GREAT coffee spot!

This is my favorite place in the neighborhood! Coffee, candy, sandwiches, salads, and great breakfast!  I go here once a day and sometimes twice. The owners are so lovely and greet you by name.  The food is fresh and the sandwiches and salads are very big!  They have wifi so you can also get some work done. And also VERY kid friendly!  I love this place so much!

Just ordered 8 sandwhiches for me and my co-workers. WOW no reason to ever walk into a run of the mill subway or deli. Everything tastes fresh and delicious. By far the best inexpensive gouremt sandwhich I have every had!!

Everything is great, from the drinks to the sandwiches, ice cream, and a play area if you have the kids. Free wifi, lots of tables, open early and even a decent grocery-style store with a few essentials.

Great place to grab a sandwich or a Julius Meinel coffee.  The adult grilled cheese was very solid and I had a create your own boar's head sandwich on a fresh pretzel roll with fresh mozzarella.  If you are in the area, stop by.

i love this place. it is so cute inside.  I was very impressed when i came across this little shop.  Their sandwiches are great! high quality ingredients! vege breakfast sandwich is great. and my daughter loves the baby food options they have for her! i wish they were open a little later tho! otherwise keep up the great work!

Never been disappointed with anything I've eaten there. Nice staff, great products and nice vibe. A fantastic lunch place with accommodations for children and adults alike. ** Missing you guys in Roscoe. Good luck in your new spot!!

The owner is sweet and lovely. The selection is fantastic (includes sandwiches, bakery goods, candies and chocolates, good drinks, etc.). The prices are not at all ridiculous given the good quality of the food. Really nice place to study/work or just eat!

I am fortunate enough to live right next door to Nohea Cafe. I love this place! Their sandwiches are amazing, my favorites being the Italian Stallion and Sweet Cubano. The owners are lovely people; you can tell they put a lot of love into their food. As a bonus, the place is very kid friendly.
Overpriced and feels catered to super fancy mommy with spoiled kids.

I go to Nohea quite a bit for coffee and meals and it has always been great. Recently I had them cater a luncheon I had and it was delicious. The sandwiches were great and there was a great mix of them, all of them held up well throughout lunch. I highly recommend.  Erin

Mmm, mmm! Wow, this place is amazing! I ordered a Roscoe Reuben and a cream of spinach soup the other day and it was heaven! Seriously one of the best sandwiches I've ever had! Very flavorful and fresh.  My husband and I have also had wonderful and delicious catering service from Nohea and couldn't be more pleased. Our guests were more than satisfied! An all around exceptional cafe with great service and food.  My only complaint is that they are not open later during the week! They close at 6 p.m. If they were open till 7 p.m. I'd be sending my husband, who works nearby, to pick up dinner here at least once a week!

Wow are the sandwiches good.  Yes, they're definitely pricier here than ayyour typical sandwich place, but you certainly get what you pay for! I'm a big fan of the Sassy Roast Beef as well as the Sausalito Turkey .  Everything I have tried here is as good as it looks! The staff is always incredibly nice, and the place itself is gorgeous and very inviting.
Best croissants this side of Paris. Awesome food. Great breakfast sandwiches. :-)

To me, Nohea Cafe is one of those quaint neighborhood places that you definitely would miss if you weren't looking for it. If I didn't have a 2Buck Duck deal, I certainly wouldn't have taken the time to look for the place. Thank goodness I did.  I went here for lunch with my sister and ordered the Italian Scallion: Ham, Salami, lettuce, tomato, giardinera, mayo and provolone on ciabatta. She ordered the chicken caprese: chicken breast, greens, tomato, mozzarella, vinaigrette dressing and mayo on foccaccia. We both had the same opinions of each of our sandwiches in that they were tasty. She liked hers better than I did though.  I do give them points for everything else though. The ambiance of the place was nice; however if you are annoyed by children running around, I give you fair warning. I didn't mind. I thought the prices were pretty reasonable too, as well as the food selection: meats, cheeses, pastries and bread.  Since it's in my neighborhood, I'd probably try this place again.
Try the Ham on Pretzel bread.  Great service and prices - glad to have them in Roscoe Village!

I LOVE this place! Sandwiches are delicious and the pastries are also tasty.  It is pricey and don't expect to get a side with your sandwich but I keep going back because it's that good.  Chicken salad and chicken caprese are my two favs with a latte.  The atmosphere is cozy and I usually stop by here alone with a book.

Cozy cafe with friendly service and delicious sandwiches. The boar's head meats really elevate a sandwich so glad to see them used here. My go to is the chicken caprese - shaved deli meat with fresh tomato and mozzarella and basil mayo.  Their coffee drinks are great too. Note - they are closed Sundays :(

I love Nohea cafe. The atmosphere is quaint and relaxed. The selection and coffee is awesome. They recently added chocolate truffles which are the best I've ever tried.  The owners Shirley and Michele are super friendly and always have a moment to chatl. You have to try them!

Truly great sandwiches.  Very very tasty.  But get it to-go.  Unless you want to be surrounded by strollers.  And the quasi-french decor and sort of a ultra-polite atmosphere is also a bit odd.  The salads are awesome too, very fresh ingredients and not overdressed at all.  Also a nice selection of chips & sodas.

Buongiorno Foccacia (6.95) -Fried egg, pancetta, baby spinach, provolone & honey -lemon mayo on foccacia-Excellent breakfast sandwich. The egg was perfect and all the flavors together were delicious served in a cute basket, but basket is not practical and would of rather had a plate. Oatmeal  (4.95) The tiniest bowl of oatmeal which is not worth the money. Just make it at home or go somewhere else for a nice big bowl of warm oatmeal. The granola was okay and my 6 year old did not like it, but I tried it and felt it need some fruit and yogurt. They have a kids breakfast menu, but 2 of the 3 items had scrambled eggs which does not appeal to my 6 year old. Pancakes would be a good addition onto there.  There was an extensive kids lunch menu. Wouldn't go back with my kids, but would go with friends or sisters.

We recently had a bridal shower here.  Top notch sandwiches (favorite was twisted ham on a pretzel roll), sweet potato chips, and drinks (pearalicious =).  These all made the day so pleasant for the guests and the bride to be.  But, the best part was the service.  Shirley (along with her husband and daughter) took care of all of us.  We requested red velvet doughnuts - they got them.  We repeatedly asked to lower and raise the volume due to games and such - they did it with a smile. Thank you, Shirley and family for saving us that day!  We couldn't have done it without you =)
Fantastic sandwiches, just a bit pricey for lunch! Great little place that knows how to do it right.

Delicious.  I have yet to eat something here that I am anything less than ecstatic about.  I wish there were a few more salads, but they always work with me to make a sandwich into a salad when I ask (I can't eat bread - bummer because theirs looks delicious!).  And I can't say enough nice things about Shirley and Michelle - they're just beyond sweet.

Love this place! Mother and daughter combo have really turned this location around from the previous owners. The ambiance is cute and very comfortable. The Sandwiches are so delicious. If you are in the Roscoe Village area and want a quick/relaxing bite stop here!
This is the best sandwich shop in Chicago.  I could go here day and night.  They are friendly and have amazing food.  I do wish they were open later, but other than that, I LOVE IT!!

Love this place!  Today was my first time visiting Nohea and I love it....they have excellent sandwiches, good coffee, free wifi, friendly staff, and a really cute, clean dining area.  I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars because, even in Roscoe Village, I have a hard time paying over $8 for a sandwich...but it was also sort of inconvenient to not have access to wifi until after 2PM since I was there for a meeting before then that may have required wifi.  That said, this is definitely a Roscoe Village gem and I'll definitely be returning.  I'm so happy to have found another great alternative to *bux!!!  :D

This place has amazing sandwiches! My boyfriend and I stopped here on a whim on Saturday since we were in the neighborhood, starving and needed something quick and easy.  Thank you Yelp app on the iphone for finding this place for us!  The chicken caprese panini was easily one of the best sandwiches I have ever had.   Every sandwich on the menu sounded better than the one before it and it was difficult to pick which one to chose!  The cafe was beyond cute and quaint, and I could see that it would be a great place for meetings and also very family friendly.   In short, I'm sad I hadn't discovered this place earlier!  Get here!
I have been here a few times now. Great place to walk to and get a bite. They make a proper cappuccino and there sandwiches are great.

This place is great!  They have wonderful specials and are super nice.  We love getting Nohea for lunch at work.   Even if you brought your lunch when someone says were getting Nohea you find an extra $10.  Its not cheap but they use boar's head meat and they best ingredients in their yummy sandwiches!  They have an assortment of cheeses and yogurts to take home and they sell the meat they use.  I have never eaten at the cafe-it is occasionally full of really loud kids-typical Roscoe Village daytime-but it seems cute and cozy.

Great Food. Great Service.  Set up like a cafe with a small grocery section, lots of beverage options, several sandwich choices and tasty desserts.   Been here a half dozen times now and every time the sandwich selection has been amazing.  The homemade potato chips are out of this world and the prices decent...especially for Roscoe Village. The place is small so a short wait for a table is to be expected....thankfully the patrons seem to be aware of this potential problem and don't appear to linger.  On each of visit I was able to snag a table by the time the food was delivered....and I have definitely been there during the lunch hour rush.  Definitely one of my favorite lunch spots.

11 dollars for a tiny sandwich, no side and small apple juice....my friend got the half sandwich and salad combo and it looked like a way better value than what I got. I'm not a huge eater either but this portion was ridiculously small. I got the chic salad and it had pretty good flavor but was a little dry, I ate there an hour ago and I'm hungry again.  I will try this place again however but was pretty disappointed  based on previous reviews.

I've only been to this place once but I was pleasantly surprised when I went. I had scheduled a business meeting at the nearby Starbucks, which was overstuffed as usual. We relocated to this quaint cafe and I'm happy we did. It was quiet, relaxing and roomy. There's wifi and a decent number of outlets, so it's a great place to work, though it gets a little busy around the lunch hour.  The coffee was good and the food was fresh and well-priced. The last I checked, they had a 4square special to get $2 off any sandwich after so many check-ins. It's definitely a place I will be returning to. The staff was also very nice and attentive.

Positives first: the specialty drinks are great, the breakfast sandwiches are really good, a little expensive, but generally worth it. The lunch sandwiches are phenomenal, definitely worth the money! And up until this point I truly loved going in to do work and have lunch As for the negatives, the list is not long, but unfortunately so bad that not only will I never return, but I won't recommend it to anyone unless you are either pregnant or have children in tow because you will unfortunately be discriminated against. I went to the café on a Saturday morning with 2 friends, we all ordered breakfast and got to doing some work. Sometime around 12:30 it got really crowded, children running around and screaming loudly, something we were willing to overlook. Shortly thereafter, we were informed by the owner herself that they did not offer wi-fi from 12-2 because it was their busiest hours and that we may have to give up our table if a "family needed it" (we had been planning on ordering lunch and had several drinks between the 3 of us already).  Needless to say we backed our belonging and left to have our lunch somewhere else, someplace were the owner doesn't have the 1950's back of the bus business mentality. A great disappoint and even greater insult.  Customer service of this quality is just plain unacceptable.

Yum! This place makes delicious sandwiches...even better than the ones from Costello's across the street. I had a Smokin' Turkey on a pretzel roll and my husband got the Spicy Salsalito. Both were very flavorful and just delicious. Also, the sandwiches were huge, so I could only eat half of mine.  The prices may be a little steep for a sandwich, but you get what you pay for. These sandwiches are worth it. I just saw from other reviews that they serve Julius Meinl coffee. I will definitely need to go back for their coffee, that's my favorite kind. I actually had heard of Nohea Cafe because around Christmas time, they had a fun little tree lighting ceremony for all of Roscoe Village. It's a great little family cafe. I hope they do that again this Christmas too.

I LOVE THIS CAFE!!!! I love the folks who run it, the food, the cozy atmosphere. It's a place I always feel welcome in, and seems to always serve a meal that is delicious. I love the Chicken Salad sandwich. You can't go wrong with Julius Meinl coffee. They have fantastic ice cream. I was just introduced to the Rising Sun Tea Latte- wonderful! I always leave happy- hope you will too!

Best place to get a quick sandwhich. Although everything on the menu sounds delicious, Ive been stuck on the spicy salsalito. Its the perfect sandwhich! They also have amazing sweet potato chips, breakfast sandwhiches and a bunch of yummy desserts. The service is always very pleasant too.

Nohea Cafe is a wonderful little cafe nestled in the heart of Roscoe Village.  The sandwiches are great and the ambiance is very comfortable.  It's a nice place for lunch alone, with friends or a company or neighborhood meeting.  It is kid friendly with many offerings for adults and children alike.

Somewhere at the intersection of phenomenal sandwiches & very friendly staff is where you will find this great little shop known as Nohea Cafe in Chicago's Roscoe Village.  I discovered this spot somewhat by accident while visiting my accountant in the area. The cafe is located near the major streets of Roscoe and Damen. From street level, I felt compelled to stop in as my eyes were instantly drawn to the colorful cakes, big cookies and interesting donuts on display.  I don't know if she was the owner or manager, but the woman behind the counter was as beautiful as she was nice. After grazing the menu, I ordered a coffee, along with a chicken sandwich and went to a table.  While waiting for my order, I couldn't help but to notice the local artwork for sale on the wall. Since Roscoe village is a pretty artsy community, it made sense that I would see Chicago photographs, and interesting abstract paintings. Nohea also has a very warm decor. The tables are large, so four people can easily enjoy lunch. The cafe is also an ideal place for moms who want to bring little kids along as there are tables with games and toys to play with.  Food  Put it this way: I was sitting at my table when the woman served my dish and my mouth dropped. My comment was, " Is that for me"? The sandwich was absolutely huge and yumalicious. I always appreciate it when a sandwich shop isn't cheap on the meat. I can't remember what all they hooked the sandwich up with, but all I can remember was it was tangy, and real good.  The only minor drawback to this cafe is that it's not open late enough. If it were open at night, I'd be there all the time.  Nohea also has a ton of other food items that look awesome, including a unique breakfast menu.  I'm going to have to go back on a Sunday morning sometime in the future.

No complaints whatsoever!  The food is good, prices are reasonable, and the seating is comfortable.  Michelle and Shirley are so friendly and nice.  I eat here frequently and have never been disappointed!

Reasons I love Nohea: Best BLTs, Julius Meinl coffee, great desserts, Michelle and Shirley are super sweet. Reasons I'm not so fond: Not open early, so no getting an early cup of coffee, but I've gotten used to that. Overall, go try this place, and order the BLT!

Skip Starbucks, Panera or Potbelly's and come here!  At Nohea Cafe you will find a long list of delicious, high quality sandwiches, excellent coffee and teas, free wifi, various cafe/deli knicknacks for sale, desserts/pastries and a wonderful, warm, comfortable ambiance.  I highly recommend Nohea Cafe for lunch, a meeting, studying or relaxing.   Additionally, my husband and I recently had our son's 1st birthday party here.  Shirley was wonderful to work with, the food was excellent, it was very reasonably priced... the party was a huge success!  They close down for private parties on Saturdays (late afternoon/early evening).  It's the perfect place for a baby or bridal shower or birthday party for 30-35 people. Stop in and check it out, you won't be disappointed!
Great sandwich place.  May cost a dollar more but you get what you pay for.   best roast beef sandwich i've ever had.   boarshead!

The Nohea Cafe has been in Roscoe Village for several months now and I had been wanting to go to but never got around to it until this past Saturday. A great little sandwich and coffee place in the neighborhood - the inside is comfortable with either booths or tables that are well spaced throughout the restaurant. The entire vibe is cozy and it's pulled off pretty well.  The food is good here - for lunch there is an assortment of salads and sandwiches that are based on your typical ham, turkey, roast beef sandwiches with a little creativity thrown in.
